responseCode.AlreadyUpdated: Gates for your alliance were already updated within the last hour.
responseCode.LoginEsiErrorAlliance: Failed to fetch alliance from ESI, please try again
responseCode.LoginEsiErrorVerify: Failed to verify character, please try again.
responseCode.LoginSsoFailed: EVE SSO login failed, please try again.
responseCode.LoginWrongAlliance: This character is not a member of one of the allowed alliances.
responseCode.SearchError: An error occurred during the ESI search. Did you authorize the required ESI scopes during login?
SearchSuccess: The Ansiblex data is now updated in the background, this may take a minute.

login.description: A route planner for EVE Online that supports Ansiblex jump gates and wormhole connections.
login-restriction: You need a character that is a member of an alliance to use all features.
It is also possible that the login is restricted to certain alliances.
login.find-route-description: This function does not require any ESI scopes.
login.write-route-description: Set route in the game, requires: esi-ui.write_waypoint.v1
login.read-location-description: Set the start system to your current location, requires: esi-location.read_location.v1
update-gates-description: Update Ansiblex jump gates for your alliance, requires:
login.token-deletion: Only you can use your ESI tokens while logged in. They are deleted when you log out.

home.select-systems: Enter your start and end system:

choose-systems: Choose systems for a wormhole connection or missing Ansiblexes.
The connection is temporarily added <1>for your character only</1> and removed after 2 days.

gate-sources: Ansiblex jump gates can be imported manually using the in-game structure browser.
The application can also find them using the <1>EVE API (ESI)</1> search,
but this must also be initiated manually.
gates-alliance: For each alliance a set of Ansiblex gates is stored.
So it is assumed that everyone in the same alliance can use the same gates.
This may not be true of course, but should be good enough for most use cases.
esi-results: Unfortunately the API does not always return all Ansiblex gates the character can use.
Instead it seems to return only gates for which the character has "docking access".
wormholes: If the route contains wormholes (temporary connection), they cannot be displayed on the map and are
For the in-game route, a waypoint is set for the system where the wormhole is located.
The wormhole system itself cannot be set as a waypoint.
pochven: It is also not possible to set waypoints to Pochven systems (Triglavian space),
unless you are in that region.
several-routes: If there are several routes with the same number of jump,
then the one with fewer Ansiblex gates is preferred.

intro: Ansiblex jump gates can be found by normal characters only with the ESI search.
Unfortunately CCP does not allow to use this API endpoint as a <1>discovery mechanism</1>.
But a manually initiated search <3>seems to be ok</3>.
updateGates.update-hint: The gates can only be updated once per hour for each alliance.

import.headline: Ansiblex Import
description: This imports Ansiblex jump gates from one region and deletes all existing gates from that region beforehand.
If the gates from the input are from different regions, only the region of the first gate is processed.
instruction: Utilities -> Structure Browser, choose "Region" and Structure Type "Ansiblex Jump Gate",
select all and drag into a new mail, select all text in the mail, right click and click
"Copy Selected With Formatting" and paste that into the input field below.
warning: WARNING: Make sure the character that copies the data from the game is in the same alliance as the character

check-in-game: Please note that an Ansiblex gate can be offline.
If this is the case, you can exclude it manually from the route.

map.svg-error: Your browser does not support SVG
